intro: Pseudaleia madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar spurge, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, colorful bracts that resemble petals. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with smooth, often greyish bark and lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in complex inflorescences called cyathia. The species is adapted to the dry, tropical climate of its native habitat and is often found in rocky or arid environments.
